questions.question: Knowing more about ___________ can help you understand people and places better.

imageMetadata.altText: illustration of a girl and a chalkboard map of the world

questions.question: Part of being a good listener means ____________.

choices.answer: solving other people’s problems for them
caring about people’s thoughts and feelings

imageMetadata.altText: the word "listen" and a dog with its ear cocked as if listening

questions.question: What’s one way to be a better listener?

choices.answer: Multi task so you can do more than one thing at a time.
Let the person know you understand what they are saying.

imageMetadata.altText: a person thinking and the words "what's your story?"
imageMetadata.resources: (PERSON THINKING) KOSTUDIO/SHUTTERSTOCK; (WORDS WHAT’S YOUR STORY) MAREKULIASZ/SHUTTERSTOCK.

questions.resources: (PERSON THINKING) KOSTUDIO/SHUTTERSTOCK; (WORDS WHAT’S YOUR STORY) MAREKULIASZ/SHUTTERSTOCK.

questions.question: What’s one way to assess if you can trust a source of information?

choices.answer: Ask if this source is popular.
Ask if this source agrees with your point of view.
Ask if this source repeats what other sources say.

imageMetadata.altText: a rubber stamp of the word "truth"
